subject: College Athletics
Basketball
lead_paragraph: Connecticut’s men’s program showed a profit of nearly $6.3 million during the 2008 fiscal year, nearly four times what the school is paying Coach Jim Calhoun. The program earned $14.07 million in revenue and had $7.8 million in expenses, according to the state Office of Legislative Research.
